content: In mathematics, what name is given to a number that can be written without a fractional or decimal component?

A number that can be written without a fractional or decimal component is called an integer. Integers include all whole numbers (positive and negative) and zero. For example, -3, -2, -1, 0, 1, 2, 3 are all integers. They do not have any decimal points or fractions attached to them.
